item.description: cook using whole ingredients as much as possible eat tons of vegetables and fruits (every meal) eat tons of nuts, seeds, legumes, beans (every meal) eat tons of olive oil (every meal) eat whole grains (every meal) eat moderate amounts of yogurt, parmesan, mozzarella, feta, cheddar, oaxaca (1x-3x/day) eat light amounts of white-meat: chicken, fish (1x/day-1x/wk) eat very light amounts of red-meat: beef, pork (>=1x/wk) Yeah honestly, this could pretty much just be called the “frugal farmers diet”, seems applicable to anywhere on earth where people subsistence farm, or at least grow a vegetable garden.
If you’re trying to grow muscle (which is possible during weight-gain or weight-loss, probably as long as it’s not rapid)
